newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's ARS sees 96 rough diamond output up 3 pct.
newsitem.headline: Russia's ARS sees 96 rough diamond output up 3 pct.

text.p: Russian diamond producer Almazy Rossii-Sakha (ARS) will increase its output of rough diamonds this year by three percent over 1995's level, Interfax news agency quoted the company's president as saying on Monday.
Vyacheslav Shtyrov gave no absolute figures at a news conference in Siberia's Yakutsk.
He also said he expected the government would soon order ARS to sign a new export agreement with South Africa's De Beers.
ARS supplies a quarter of De Beers output, nearly all of Russia's diamonds, and is Russia's sole authorised diamond exporter.
